title: 'Apologise To Indians': Parliamentary Panel To Summon Meta Over Zuckerberg's Poll Loss Remark - News18
Maha Kumbh: First 'Amrit Snan' held, over 3.5 crore devotees take holy dip in Sangam on Makar Sankranti - Deccan Herald
summary:
Over 3.5 Crore Devotees Participate in First 'Amrit Snan' at Maha Kumbh

Published: 14 January 2025, 13:32 IST

On the occasion of 'Makar Sankranti', over 3.5 crore devotees, including seers and saints from various Akharas, took a holy dip at the Sangam in Prayagraj for the first 'Amrit Snan' of the Mahakumbh festival.

  • More than 3.5 crore devotees participated in the ritual.
  • Uttar Pradesh police reported that over 1.6 crore devotees took the holy dip around noon.
  • The bathing ceremony commenced at dawn with different Akharas taking turns.
  • Seers displayed their weapons as part of the rituals.
  • Extensive security measures were implemented with over 60 thousand personnel deployed.
“The first 'Amrit Snan' went off well and there was no report of any untoward incident.” - UP principal secretary home Sanjay Prasad

This event marks a significant occasion in the Mahakumbh festival, emphasizing its cultural and religious importance.
newTitle: Over 3.5 Crore Devotees Participate in First 'Amrit Snan' at Maha Kumbh

title: Centre clears appointment of Justice Alok Aradhe as Bombay High Court Chief Justice - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Justice Alok Aradhe Appointed as Chief Justice of Bombay High Court

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 1:27 pm

The Central government has approved the appointment of Justice Alok Aradhe as the Chief Justice of the Bombay High Court.

  • The President confirmed the transfer of Justice Aradhe in accordance with Article 222 of the Constitution.
  • Justice Aradhe previously served as the Chief Justice of the Telangana High Court.
  • He will succeed Chief Justice DK Upadhyaya, who is moving to the Delhi High Court.
  • Justice Aradhe's judicial career includes roles in the Madhya Pradesh High Court, Jammu and Kashmir High Court, and Karnataka High Court.
"In exercise of the power conferred by clause (1) of Article 222 of the Constitution of India, the President, after consultation with the Chief Justice of India, is pleased to transfer Shri Justice Alok Aradhe..."

Justice Aradhe is expected to assume his new responsibilities shortly.
newTitle: Justice Alok Aradhe Appointed as Chief Justice of Bombay High Court

title: Blow to NCP(SP), Sena (UBT) bids to warm up to Mahayuti as Amit Shah targets Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray - The Indian Express
summary:
Amit Shah Critiques Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (SP) Amid Political Realignments

Publication Date: Recently
Source: Indian Express

Union Home Minister Amit Shah has targeted Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena (UBT) and the Sharad Pawar-led NCP (SP) during a BJP state executive meeting, asserting that the Eknath Shinde-headed Shiv Sena and the Ajit Pawar-led NCP are the genuine representatives of their parties.

  • Shah emphasized that the BJP aims to unseat the Shiv Sena (UBT) from the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC).
  • Shah criticized the political history of betrayal associated with Pawar and Thackeray.
  • Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis stressed the importance of hard work ahead of the upcoming local body polls.
  • Reactions from NCP(SP) and Shiv Sena (UBT) members highlighted a trend in attacks against Sharad Pawar.
  • Recent political shifts in Maharashtra have raised speculation about potential new alliances.
“The resounding mandate in the BJP’s favour has put an end to the politics of betrayal which Sharad Pawar started in 1978.” - Amit Shah

This political landscape suggests continued tensions and realignments within Maharashtra's political parties as the BJP prepares for local elections.
newTitle: Amit Shah Critiques Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (SP) Amid Political Realignments

title: Haryana BJP chief Mohal Lal Badoli, singer Rocky Mittal booked for gang-rape of Delhi resident in Himachal - The Indian Express
Haryana BJP chief Mohal Lal Badoli, singer Rocky Mittal booked for gang-rape of Delhi resident in Himachal - The Indian Express
Ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar moves Supreme Court for anticipatory bail - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Seeks Anticipatory Bail from Supreme Court

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 12:06 pm

Former IAS trainee Puja Khedkar has approached the Supreme Court to challenge the Delhi High Court's rejection of her anticipatory bail plea amid allegations of fraud related to reservation benefits.

  • Khedkar is accused of fraudulently availing reservation for OBC and Persons with Disabilities for UPSC exam.
  • The FIR cites existing documents in possession of the prosecution, suggesting no need for custodial interrogation.
  • She claims lack of criminal antecedents and entitlements under the All India Services Act and Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act.
  • UPSC has cancelled her selection and barred her from future exams due to these allegations.
  • The High Court initially granted Khedkar interim protection but subsequently vacated it, establishing a prima facie case against her.
“The material revealed that she was not a fit candidate for such benefits and that she had forged documents.” - Justice Chandra Dhari Singh

Khedkar's case reflects larger issues surrounding the integrity of public service examinations and the reservation system.
newTitle: Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Seeks Anticipatory Bail from Supreme Court

title: Justice Ashutosh Kumar appointed Acting Chief Justice of Patna High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Justice Ashutosh Kumar appointed Acting Chief Justice of Patna High Court

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 11:55 am

The Central government has notified the appointment of Justice Ashutosh Kumar as Acting Chief Justice of the Patna High Court.

  • Justice Kumar will succeed Chief Justice KV Chandran, who was elevated to the Supreme Court.
  • The notification was issued under Article 223 of the Constitution of India.”
  • Justice Kumar has had a long and distinguished career in law, having been appointed as an additional judge in 2014.
“In exercise of the power conferred by Article 223 of the Constitution of India, the President is pleased to appoint Shri Justice Ashutosh Kumar, Judge of the Patna High Court, to perform the duties of office of the Chief Justice of that High Court...”

This appointment marks a significant transition within the Patna High Court following the elevation of former Chief Justice KV Chandran.
newTitle: Justice Ashutosh Kumar appointed Acting Chief Justice of Patna High Court

title: Body shaming unacceptable: Kerala High Court in Boby Chemmanur bail order - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala High Court Declares Body Shaming Unacceptable in Bail Order for Boby Chemmanur

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 11:45 am | Source: Media Reports

The Kerala High Court stated that body shaming is unacceptable in any form, during a bail hearing for businessman Boby Chemmanur, accused of making inappropriate comments about a Malayalam actress.

  • Justice PV Kunhikrishnan emphasized the need to avoid comments about people's bodies and highlighted the importance of being vigilant when making remarks about others.
  • The court quoted motivational speaker Dr. Steve Maraboli, underscoring that judging a woman by her appearance reflects on the judge, not the judged.
  • Boby Chemmanur was previously arrested for alleged sexual harassment and body shaming of an actress during an event.
  • The court found there were sufficient grounds to grant bail, noting the maximum possible punishment for the alleged offenses would only be 3 years.
“Body shaming is not acceptable in our society.”
Kerala High Court

The court concluded that future inappropriate comments on social media from Chemmanur must be avoided. His counsel assured the court of this commitment.
newTitle: Kerala High Court Declares Body Shaming Unacceptable in Bail Order for Boby Chemmanur

title: Kerala man killed, one hurt in Russia-Ukraine conflict, confirms MEA - The Times of India
summary:
Kerala Man Killed, One Hurt in Russia-Ukraine Conflict, Confirms MEA

Date: 2023-10-01 Source: Times of India

An Indian national from Kerala has been killed and another injured in the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict, as confirmed by the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA).

  • The incident highlights the continued risks faced by Indians abroad as global conflicts escalate.
  • The MEA has assured that all necessary assistance will be provided to the victims’ families.
  • This event raises concerns about the safety of Indian expatriates in war-torn regions.
"The Ministry of External Affairs is in touch with the families of the affected individuals."

This tragic event underscores the dangers posed to Indians living in foreign conflict zones and the importance of diplomatic support in such situations.
newTitle: Kerala Man Killed, One Hurt in Russia-Ukraine Conflict, Confirms MEA

title: National Turmeric Board inaugurated in Telangana’s Nizamabad - The Siasat Daily
summary:
National Turmeric Board inaugurated in Telangana's Nizamabad

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Siasat Daily

The National Turmeric Board was inaugurated in Telangana’s Nizamabad district on January 14, by Union minister Piyush Goyal.

  • Palle Gangareddy, a BJP leader and turmeric farmer, appointed as chairman of the board.
  • The minister emphasized the potential to increase turmeric productivity in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana.
  • The board aims to support 'Golden Spice' farmers and enhance export opportunities.
  • The establishment of the board was announced by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 1, 2023.
  • In 2023-24, 1.62 lakh tonnes of turmeric valued at $226.5 million were exported.
“There is immense potential of increasing productivity of turmeric in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. Pay special attention to the welfare of ‘Golden Spice’ farmers.” - Piyush Goyal

The creation of the National Turmeric Board is expected to aid farmers through the entire supply chain, from value addition to infrastructure development.
newTitle: National Turmeric Board inaugurated in Telangana's Nizamabad

title: Delhi Police link student behind school bomb threats with politically-affiliated NGO - The Hindu
‘INDIA bloc only for national elections’, says Sharad Pawar on Shiv Sena (UBT)'s local polls decision - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sharad Pawar States INDIA Bloc is Limited to National Elections Amid Shiv Sena's Local Poll Decision

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sharad Pawar, chief of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), has clarified that the INDIA bloc of opposition parties is intended solely for national elections, causing concerns regarding the future of the alliance. This statement follows the Shiv Sena (UBT)'s announcement to contest local body elections independently in Maharashtra.

  • The Shiv Sena (UBT) has decided to fight local elections alone.
  • Pawar emphasized there were no discussions about local elections within the INDIA alliance.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding opportunities for party workers in an alliance.
  • Pawar's remarks come after the Shiv Sena's recent support for Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Delhi.
“There has never been any discussion on state and local elections in INDIA alliance. INDIA alliance is only for national-level elections.” - Sharad Pawar

This situation raises questions about the unity of the opposition as the local body elections approach.
newTitle: Sharad Pawar States INDIA Bloc is Limited to National Elections Amid Shiv Sena's Local Poll Decision

title: Bomb hoax: 'Parents of accused linked to NGO that opposed Afzal's hanging'; BJP targets AAP - The Times of India
summary:
Bomb hoax: 'Parents of accused linked to NGO that opposed Afzal's hanging'; BJP targets AAP

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

A recent bomb hoax incident has drawn attention towards the parents of the individuals involved, who have ties to a non-governmental organization that opposed the hanging of Afzal Guru. This has led to political backlash from the BJP towards the AAP government.

  • Parents of the accused are linked to an NGO critical of Afzal's execution.
  • The BJP has used this incident to criticize the AAP party.
  • Political tensions are escalating around this issue.
“This incident raises questions about the motives of those opposing justice.” - BJP Spokesperson

The hoax and its implications highlight ongoing political disputes and the contentious nature of justice in high-profile cases.
newTitle: Bomb Hoax Linked to NGO Involvement in Afzal's Hanging Controversy; BJP Criticizes AAP

title: Laurene Powell Jobs faces health issues at Maha Kumbh, recovering after 'Ganga snan' - The Hindu
summary:
Laurene Powell Jobs Recovers After Health Issues at Maha Kumbh

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Laurene Powell Jobs, the widow of Steve Jobs, faced health issues but is recovering after participating in the 'Ganga snan' during the Maha Kumbh.

  • Jobs was overwhelmed by the crowds at the Maha Kumbh but is now feeling better.
  • She has a keen interest in Sanatan Dharma and has been given the name 'Kamla' by her guru.
  • Swami Kailashanand Giri praised her humility and eagerness to learn.
  • Jobs maintains a low profile, avoiding media attention during the event.
  • She is staying at the Niranjani Akhara for a few days.
"Her enthusiasm to delve deeper into Sanatan Dharma remains strong," said Swami Kailashanand.

This experience highlights Laurene Powell Jobs' spiritual journey and her dedication to understanding the cultural significance of the Maha Kumbh.
newTitle: Laurene Powell Jobs Recovers After Health Issues at Maha Kumbh

title: Parliamentary panel to summon Meta over Mark Zuckerberg's remark on India polls: BJP MP - Hindustan Times
summary:
Parliamentary Committee to Summon Meta Over Zuckerberg's Comments on 2024 India Elections

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

BJP MP Nishikant Dubey stated that Meta's CEO Mark Zuckerberg will be summoned by the parliamentary committee due to his remarks suggesting the Indian government lost the 2024 elections over its Covid-19 handling.

  • Zuckerberg claims a global breakdown of trust in governments due to Covid-19.
  • Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw counters Zuckerberg’s claims, asserting the re-election of PM Narendra Modi.
  • The committee aims to address misinformation and protect democratic integrity.
“Incorrect information tarnishes the image of any democratic country.” - Nishikant Dubey

The controversy highlights the tension between social media narratives and political realities, emphasizing the importance of factual discourse in democracy.
newTitle: Parliamentary Committee to Summon Meta Over Zuckerberg's Comments on 2024 India Elections

title: Meta To Get Parliamentary Panel Summons Over Zuckerberg's India Poll Remark - NDTV
summary:
"Would Have To Apologise...": House Panel To Summon Mark Zuckerberg's Meta

Date: January 10, 2024

Source: New Delhi

Social media giant Meta is set to be summoned by a Parliamentary Standing Committee due to remarks made by its CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, regarding the 2024 Indian general election.

  • Meta is being accused of spreading misinformation about the electoral results in India.
  • Zuckerberg's comments suggested a global trend where incumbent governments lost elections due to the COVID pandemic, incorrectly citing India as an example.
  • Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw countered Zuckerberg's claims, stating that the NDA led by PM Modi retained trust among voters in the recent elections.
  • The BJP faced some setbacks in elections but maintained a majority with support from allies.
"Misinformation on a democratic country maligns its image. The organization would have to apologize to the Parliament and the people here for this mistake." - Nishikant Dubey

The ruling BJP's response highlights the importance of factual accuracy in public statements, especially from influential leaders like Zuckerberg.
newTitle: "Would Have To Apologise...": House Panel To Summon Mark Zuckerberg's Meta

title: Deputation of Senior Assistants & Junior Assistants for Training Course at J&K IMPARD - Cross Town News
‘Jammu and Kashmir incomplete without PoK’: Defence minister Rajnath Singh - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Jammu and Kashmir incomplete without PoK’: Defence minister Rajnath Singh

Date: Jan 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Defence minister Rajnath Singh emphasized that Jammu and Kashmir is 'incomplete' without Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) and cautioned Pakistan against the existence of terrorist training camps in the region.

  • Singh stated that PoK is essentially a foreign territory for Pakistan.
  • He warned that the land is being exploited for fostering terrorism.
  • At the 9th Armed Forces Veterans' Day event, he highlighted historical conflicts, referencing a potential end to cross-border terrorism in 1965.
  • Singh acknowledged the sacrifices made by the Muslim community in fighting against terrorism.
  • He pointed out the government's priority to bridge the gap between Kashmir and the rest of India.
"Our Muslim brothers have sacrificed their lives fighting against terrorism. More than 80 per cent of terrorists entering India are from Pakistan."

The Defence Minister's remarks come in the context of ongoing tensions and the importance of unity between regions in India, as articulated during the Armed Forces Veterans' Day celebrations.
newTitle: Rajnath Singh: Jammu and Kashmir Incomplete Without PoK

title: MeT predicts light snow over higher reaches of J-K on Jan 16 - Greater Kashmir
At least six Army personnel injured in landmine explosion in J&K’s Rajouri - The Hindu
summary:
Landmine Explosion Injures Six Army Personnel in Jammu and Kashmir

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: PTI

At least six Army personnel were injured in a landmine explosion while on patrol duty in Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir.

  • The incident occurred near Khamba Fort in the Nowshera sector around 10:45 AM.
  • Initial reports indicate that one soldier accidentally triggered the explosion by stepping on the landmine.
  • The injured personnel were quickly transported to the hospital, and their condition is stable.
  • Landmines are commonly placed in forward areas as part of an anti-infiltration obstacle system, but weather can cause these to become displaced.
“The troops were on patrol duty when one of the soldiers accidentally stepped over the landmine.”

This incident highlights the dangers faced by military personnel in conflict zones, particularly with the prevalence of landmines in sensitive areas.
newTitle: Landmine Explosion Injures Six Army Personnel in Jammu and Kashmir

title: 'PoK being used to run business of terrorism': Rajnath Singh criticises Chaudhry Anwarul Haq's anti-India - The Times of India
summary:
Rajnath Singh Critiques Anwarul Haq's Anti-India Comments Amid Terrorism Allegations

Publication Date: Not Specified | Source: Times of India

In recent statements, Indian Defense Minister Rajnath Singh condemned remarks made by Chaudhry Anwarul Haq regarding India, claiming that Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK) is being utilized to support terrorism.

  • Singh emphasized the link between PoK and terrorism.
  • The comments come amid ongoing tensions between India and Pakistan.
  • Singh's remarks highlight India’s stance on regional security.
"The situation in PoK is alarming, and it is clear that it is being used for terror financing and anti-India activities." - Rajnath Singh

This statement underscores India’s concerns regarding terrorism emanating from Pakistan and highlights the ongoing conflict over Kashmir.
newTitle: Rajnath Singh Critiques Anwarul Haq's Anti-India Comments Amid Terrorism Allegations

title: BJP govt treats Delhi, Kashmir equally: Rajnath - The Hindu
Steve Jobs’ wife Laurene Powell falls ill at Mahakumbh 2025: ‘Never been to such a crowded place’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Laurene Powell Jobs Falls Ill During Mahakumbh 2025

Date: January 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Laurene Powell Jobs, the widow of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, experienced an allergic reaction during her spiritual visit to the Mahakumbh Mela 2025 in Prayagraj, India. She visited notable sites including the Kashi Vishwanath temple.

  • Laurene is participating in the Mahakumbh ceremony and will stay at the Niranjini Akhara camp until January 15.
  • She is set to attend President-elect Donald Trump's swearing-in on January 20 after her return to the US.
  • Spiritual leader Swami Kailashanand Giri mentioned she is currently resting due to allergies from the crowd.
  • Over one crore devotees have attended the Mahakumbh Mela this year.
  • Steve Jobs' letter expressing his wish to attend Kumbh Mela sold for ₹4.32 crore at auction.
“She has never been to such a crowded place. She is pretty simple.” - Swami Kailashanand Giri

The Mahakumbh Mela continues to attract millions, symbolizing unity and spiritual significance, drawing both local and international attention.
newTitle: Laurene Powell Jobs Falls Ill During Mahakumbh 2025

title: India summons envoy: Why Bangladesh has objected to fencing along the border - The Indian Express
summary:
India summons envoy: Why Bangladesh has objected to fencing along the border

Publication Date: January 2025

Source: The Indian Express

In a recent statement, India's Ministry of External Affairs expressed that India has maintained all bilateral agreements concerning border fencing with Bangladesh. This statement follows a formal objection raised by Bangladesh regarding India's Border Security Force (BSF) activities along the international border.

  • The Bangladesh government summoned India's High Commissioner in Dhaka, expressing concerns over the construction of a barbed wire fence in West Bengal.
  • The two nations share a vast border of approximately 4,096.7 km, with multiple points of contention regarding border management.
  • Recent tensions arose from incidents in Malda and Cooch Behar, where Bangladesh's Border Guards attempted to halt construction of fencing.
  • There are established 1975 guidelines prohibiting defense structures within 150 yards of the international border.
  • Negotiations have been ongoing for years regarding the installation of smart fencing, which incorporates electronic surveillance.
“It is estimated that about 60 per cent of trans-border crimes take place where there is no fencing.” - Surjeet Singh Guleria, Inspector General (Retd), BSF

Negotiations continue over the disputes, with implications for security and local communities along the border.
newTitle: India and Bangladesh in Border Fencing Dispute

title: Viral post: CA makes detailed sheet to split payment among friends to avoid 'chance of error' - The Times of India
Viral post: CA makes detailed sheet to split payment among friends to avoid 'chance of error' - The Times of India

'Maintain decorum of home minister’s post': Sharad Pawar hits back at Amit Shah - Deccan Herald
summary:
Maintain decorum of home minister’s post: Sharad Pawar hits back at Amit Shah

Date: 14 January 2025, Source: Deccan Herald

Sharad Pawar responds to Amit Shah's accusations of betrayal, emphasizing the importance of decorum in the role of Home Minister and referencing past political dynamics.

  • Pawar was targeted by Shah, who accused him of political betrayal since 1978.
  • Pawar reminded Shah of his past externment during the Sohrabuddin case.
  • He highlighted past collaborative politics with leaders from the Jan Sangh.
  • Pawar indicated the decline of respectful political communication in contemporary politics.
“This country has seen many excellent Home Ministers, but none of them was externed from his state.”

This exchange reflects not only the ongoing political rivalry but also the shifting nature of political discourse in India.
newTitle: Sharad Pawar Defends Home Minister Post Amid Criticism from Amit Shah

title: 6 army personnel injured in landmine explosion in J&K's Rajouri - The Times of India
summary:
6 Army Personnel Injured in Landmine Explosion in J&K's Rajouri

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Not specified

Six army personnel were injured in a landmine explosion that occurred in the Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir. The incident highlights the ongoing dangers faced by security forces in the region.

  • The explosion took place while the personnel were on patrol.
  • Locals reported an increase in activities related to landmines in the area.
  • The injured soldiers have been evacuated and are receiving medical treatment.
"The explosion serves as a reminder of the persistent threats in conflict zones such as Jammu and Kashmir."

The incident underscores the risks faced by soldiers deployed in sensitive areas, emphasizing the need for continued vigilance and support.
newTitle: 6 Army Personnel Injured in Landmine Explosion in J&K's Rajouri
